title: So is it just me
body: Or was giving Meija's/Sword of the Occult five free stacks the dumbest thing in the world?

replies.body:
the main reason i see rito did that, is because when you are ahead and buy it to snowball more...you used to waste so much gold on stats, when you could have got those 2 items that akuen said and snowball more off items that actually help AT THE TIME and scale into late. before it was all about the gamble of can you maintain dominance with the lower AP/AD compared to if you went for NLR or such. but now the real gamble is on the resulting play, IE surviving.

just remember, support jannas and such getting mejais and just getting free assists to stack it, a death here and there didnt hurt cos you get back all the stacks you lose in just 1-2 teamfights. now, if janna gets caught out with that mejais...she can lose a large number and it will take longer to get them back.
doesnt count for the fact kat can just get mejais and aby and dominate any AP mid laners atm....so BS.
I liked the old one better.

you lose 50% on death, and occult gives AS not MS.

basically, it makes the snowball items REALLY about snowballing and staying alive.
makes getting them a real choice. "can i stay alive with this?" if no, dont get it. if yes, get it...or not. whereas before you could just win 1-2 teamfights and still die and come out ahead.

not sure how i feel about it yet, as ive only done 1 bots game since changes and mid got it and freaked out that it had 5 stacks lel. (and only got it for the MS boost for hec....)

Okay, let's just explain exactly what Meijai's with 5 stacks does. So, for 1400g you get 60 AP (20 base, 40 from stacks). Comparable AP items around the same price are Haunting Guise and Needlessly Large Rod. HG costs 1485, gives 25 AP, 200 hp and 15 Mag pen. NLR gives 80 AP.

So basically what this means is that there's no gamble to buying a Meijai's. Comparable value items give you either significantly less, or marginally more AP. Losing half the stacks has minimal effect because you shouldn't be holding onto it past three items or so anyway. In it's current state, Meijai's is flat out broken. Sword of the Occult is pretty strong too, but I haven't used it as much.

youre suppose to buy it early as your soul damage item and then not die

ie buying in full tank after to ensure that you dont

I don't agree with these items have 5 starting stacks to them, and would rather see their base values being upped a little bit. However, that would be something like setting a ten to a twenty. To be honest though, they are only items that are viable in games where you are so ridiculously ahead. That isn't often. Whether or not you start with five stacks won't matter for the people who really should be building them, as I would assume they'd reach twenty stacks either way. To be honest though, I think they are kinda silly items and don't see why they even exist. If you are so far ahead, you have the gold to build whatever you want anyway and have tonnes more AD/AP than everyone else.
